reviewHeadline: Attention Buyers ! Many 5 Star Reviews here are Made Up look for Verified Purchase Reviews
reviewContent: First of all this is Not a Review. I am putting this here so that people buying can realize that all 5 Star / 4 Star 'Awesome' Reviews here are made up reviews and you can Guess who left them here. I googled many of the 5 Star Reviewers name left here and found many linkedin profiles that stated they work for Panasonic India. Wait for a Review by some Tech websites before buying this thing. Panasonic Eluga Icon do have some cool specs..a big 3500mAh Battery.. but it is still running on Android Kitkat. This has identical specs to the Alcatel Flash Plus. I wouldn't be surprised if this is just a rebranded version of the same. Edit : This post was made when there was plenty of 5 Star Reviews when the device wasn't even in Stock. Since many have purchased this now, check out the "Verified Purchase" reviews to see how good this device is. 153 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: Asus Zenfone Max FUll Detailed Review
reviewContent: Taiwanese electronics company Asus has made it’s Asus Zenfone Max available to buy last week. Asus Zenfone Max was showcased earlier in August of 2015 but wasn’t available to buy that time. Zenfone Max is now available on online as well as offline retail stores. Launched at the beginning of this month, Asus Zenfone Max ZC550KL‘s biggest highlight is it’s very powerful battery. Zenfone Max ZC550KL has a whooping 5000mAh battery which can also work as a Power bank. Asus Zenfone Max is packed by a big 5000mAh long-lasting Battery which will let you do more online, watch longer video and talk as much as you want. With 5000mAh battery capacity Zenfone Max turns into an inbuilt power bank that allows you to charge other devices on the go with a USB on-the-go (OTG) cable. Asus Zenfone Max promises to deliver upto 37.6 hrs 3G talktime, upto 32.5 hrs Browsing, upto 22.6 hrs Video Playback ........Continue Reading....Asus Zenfone Max Full Review 5 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: Asus hits the Sweet spot! Ideal companion for everyone
reviewContent: Zenfone Max is true to its name. # Build quality: 10/10 Top notch # Battery longevity : 10/10 2 days backup on very heavy usage. In fact it can serve as power bank for other devices in case the need be. # Display : 9/10 Crisp and accurate. Ideal for reading mails or e-books or movies. # Zen UI : 9/10 One of the best custom android UI out there. Quite amendable to one's tastes. # Touch responsivess : 10/10 Absolutely spot on # Processor : 8/10 Not the best processor but ideal for normal users. Almost lacking any lag or delay in day to day use. # Heating issue : 10/10 No heating at all. Mi users please take note this is simply in an another league. Mi phones though serve the unintended purpose of heater in winters. # Value for money : 10/10 Absolute gem for the 9999 price paid. No premium being paid for the powerhouse inside. About Asus : NOT CHINESE, it is a TAIWANESE multinational brand who holds the expertise in computing since years. And are well placed and here to stay for years. Service centers are easily available in most nooks and corners of the country. 5000 mAh battery is class leading and it doesnt make the device as bulky as one one would expect. In fact, owing to nice weight distribution, it doesnt feel that heavy to hold. I will first answer some of the misconceptions about phone which are given in some reviews - 1) We can put 2 sims AND a sd card.. It doesnt have hybrid sim as pointed out by some. Remove the battery and you will notice that the slot has 2 compartments, one for sim and other for SD card. And Another sim card slot is clearly visible on right side of back. 2) Many said that camera is not upto the mark, but I think they just know how to press click button only. There are many options for clicking pictures in many scenario. Camera is really good considering the price. What were you expecting?? DSLR type pics... Mobile camera doesn't have much manual control and many things like OIS are only provided in high end mobiles. Believe me, camera of this mobile is very very good. You will notice the difference if you will compare pics by other mobiles in the same price range. 3) Some are even saying that there is no charger in the box. You can see charger lying in the box. Why people are giving absurd reviews. Now, here's the review of this mobile - Display - display is awesome. Also gorilla glass 4 is provided. No need of using screen guard and making the screen look dull. Also fingerprints proof because of oleophobic coating. Front Camera - Front camera is really good. It is 13mp but pics will not look like as if they are taken from 13mp mobile camera. But the pics you get from the front camera of this mobile are really great. They are not like the 5mp type of other mobiles. You will really love the front camera. Quality is really great and even dual tone flash is provided in front camera. If you take too much pics with front camera then strictly speaking, buy this mobile. Period. Rear camera - It is 13mp with dual tone flash (don't confuse dual tone with 2 led flash) and some features like laser focus are not found in other mobiles below 20,000. Now, point and click will give you nice pictures but if you want quality pictures than use the manual control and many features like in depth pic, manual mode and others. Some features are really awesome like if you are taking pic in a busy place and someone passes from front of you than there is a option which remove these type of things and there are many features like this. Don't expect pictures to be like as they come in DSLR. If mobiles were able to take that kind of quality pics then why people will buy DSLR. Mobile camera is not for professional photography but only to do the job of capturing some epic moments in life. RAM - you will get at max like 2100 mb free and there will always be like 700mb free even if you open many apps. So to use whole of the free ram, you have to open many apps and rarely someone opens more than 10 apps simultaneously. Ram will not cause any issue unlike my last samsung mobile. ZEN UI - I personally don't like the look of zen ui and also not in the mood of installing other launchers. But you can make zen ui look great by making few changes in the settings and downloading some good icon pack. Now, my ui is looking completely differenet as comapred to what factory settings provided. Battery - Now, this is where mobile let you down. Considering full hd display and a very nice processor, it was expected that battery consumption will be more. In standby mode, battery will hardly show any sign of depletion. In my case, battery went down to 2% only in 2.5 hours in stand by mode but while using things like wifi and others, consumption will be fast. But ultra saving mode is also provided by asus. And, I was using mobile in 90% brightness, if you will lower it then it may last long. I think on an average it will last 18-24 hours considering you use it normally. Also charging the battery takes time, it is where asus let this mobile down. But, even moto play battery is down in a day considering they provided 3650 mah battery. So, better option is Asus, I think. Processor - you can search about the snapdragon 615 processor in google, Period. Internal space - you will get 22-23gb free space from 32 gb provided. Build factor - I personally like the volume buttons on back and it doesnt feel like cheap mobile. Few cons - 1) You will not feel the lag anywhere expect while viewing photos after clicking them. Mobile takes some time processing it. 2) Battery may be a problem for some but not for normal user. Few Pros - 1) Front camera is really really awesome. 2) Display + Gorilla Glass 4 + Oleophobic coating. Period. read more ? 32 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: Ordered itReceived it Used it for a dayReviewed it.
reviewContent: i was eagerly waiting for device to come in stock.And when it did...Ordered it-Received it- Used it for a day-Reviewed it. Lets not waste your time..... ---------------------------------------------------- +KEY FINDINGS ( PROS+CONS ) ---------------------------------------------------- Good to see IR blasters in such a cheap device. -Works pretty good as a usual remote controller. The entire handset is plastic built.The design is not top notch but still it looks and feels good in hands. Considering the price point i would say its more than what you pay for. The ear piece on the front has metallic protection.Sound quality through it is satisfactory. The front and back shooter are equipped with flash. The sound quality from the main speaker is good as seen in other quality phones.Its very loud and didn't notice muffling . The navigation buttons are well placed and are pretty responsive. -They are backlit display is bright and vibrant .Yes it is HD but the viewing angles are on the below average side.As said you could get better display at the same price point. Comes with lollipop installed so you are getting almost the latest from android as of now(5.0...not 5.1).The UI is decent as stock ones. Karbonn has done a great job in keeping the OS clean,without loading it with much of the unnecessary bloatware. Out of 16gb an approx. of 11 Gb is user available.And out of 2GB RAM 1.45 gb is free. which again is a good thing. It is well equipped with a decent version of mediatech CPU.which is a quad core one. It Handles the device well,didn't see any lag in normal usage or app switching and all. The glass on the front is very reflective and also fingerprint magnet.(tempered glass recommended) . both the camera seems to perform really good.The images are sharp and well saturated.Takes the pic real quick. Battery also is doing a decent job.No quick battery drain issues as of yet as i have noticed in some other devices in the same price range.I guess it will last a day and so for a normal user. didn't play much of the games expect temple run and some of the light games.As usual it did handle those really easily. no heating as of a normal usage nor when i payed light games.Will update about that later after playing some heavy ones. Surely,This device is not a beast in performance but considering the price and the specification it offers i guess its a great value for money.I have no regrets buying this device. will recommend to those who need decent camera with great selfie,decent day to day performance,good sound output, good battery life,least bloatware and comparatively decent after sales support. ----------------------- One Last Thing Just in case if you like my review then please click on the 'YES' button below. read more ? 507 users found this review helpful helpful?
Nice 100 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: Biggest mistake to Buy a KARBONN mobile
reviewContent: The phone provided to me was a defective piece. It was delivered to me on 21-01-2016. However on 14-Feb-2016 (Not even 1 month), the screen would not turn on. On 15-Feb-2016 the phone was submitted to Techno Care (Authorised Karbonn Service centre in Kolkata). reviewHeadline: Not So Good Not SO Bad.......I Suggest Not To BuY this phone
reviewContent: Before buying this C5 Xperia I was in a big Dilemma.... Whether to buy Xperia C5 or Mto X Play......Every one suggested to me to buy Moto X Play After reading some negative comments and reviews also I went with SonyC5.......Because I am a die-hard Sony mobile fan....from last 10-12 yrs I m using Sony only.........But this product (Xperia C5) is not up to mark..... Below are the issues faced by me within 3 days of use :- Pros - 1. Size of phone is too gud. 2. Camera quality is gud both front and rear....as both are of same pixels i.e. of 13. 3. Good looks. Cons - 1. Heating issue.......phone goes on heat w/o using heavily also..if u use simple apps also like whtsapp etc then also set HEATS up. 2. BIGGEST PROBLEM I M FACING is the BATTERY.........I had never expected this from SONY......after spending 26k-27k Battery is not at all up to the mark even extremely POOR BATTERY SONY had deployed on this set. And it takes tooo much time to get charged. 3. Some times my phone does not ring......no alarms sound and etc............ But when I switch off it and again switch on then t works fine.......with in three days of usage i faced this issue twice. 4. Headphone provided with the set also not so good one as compared to the handsfree provided with other sony sets. I will not suggest to buy this phone..........Because it is too highly priced.....and battery is major issue I am facing. I am thinking to return my phone to flipkart...and to replace with some other phone. If any phone which is similar and suggestive to buy........Please share with me....I will appreciate your support and suggestions. read more ? 16 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: Awesome phone!! Rival to iPhone 6 Plus ....
reviewContent: I just bought this phone from one of our local store as I was not ready to wait for the delivery time. However, I know Amazon is the most trusted online retailer and my online buying experience have always been fantastic with Amazon. Being an Mobile Application developer I keep on buying phones very frequently and used almost all the handsets. Thus, I need to compromise and overlook the cost factors whatever be the cost. The phone is really costly for the ordinary users but, if you need this for some socio status maintenance in comparison to iPhone then, you can go for it. The honest review from my side is - Pros : 1. Elegant look - Gorilla Corning glass on both sides is making it super shiny. The curved edges are awesome and you will fall in love of these curved edges. Trust me if you go by look then nothing can beat it. In my office most of the people use iPhone still they love this. 2. Absolutely beautiful design - sleekest phone with heavy performance. 3. Display - incomparable display and resolution. 4. Performance wise super fast because of it's Octacore Exynos 7 series processor and 4 GB RAM. I am not a Game lover you can enjoy games to it's fullest. 5. Handset gets heated on extensive network and graphics usage but, manageable. 6. Battery life is fairly good with all day 3G but, not the best (please don't compare it with iPhone) - you can expect 10-12 Hours for calls, continuous WhatsApp and Facebook over 3G. 7. Camera quality is beautiful moreover, you can take beginner level photography shots too. 8. However you can switch on the Ultra Power Saving Mode at low battery(10%) which will keep you running more 8 to 10 hours. 9. Fingerprint sensor is nice and accurate. 10. Multi tasking is beautiful and performance optimised. Cons: 1. Initially I was comparing it with my iPhone 6 Plus with respect to battery it fails but, still if I compare the functionalities, hardware capabilities then surely I am ready to compromise. 2. Sleekest design carries the biggest chance to slip. read more ? 33 users found this review helpful helpful?

I pre-ordered my phone on 26th Aug and received it on the 31 of August, So I am writing a review after a week of use, I will start with a detailed review on the Battery: Day 1(less usage): removed from full charge at 8:00AM in the morning and used till 8:00PM before recharging- from 100% it fell to 55% with less usage like clicking a dozen pics, little whatsapp and facebook and played a few games etc Day 2(High usage): started using it heavily - kept the wifi on whole day, used bluetooth for headset, clicked a few dozen pics& selfies,played games like temple run 2 for about 30 mins,lot of talking etc the battery fell to 33% from 9am to 8pm. So the bottom line is that the 3000Mah battery will easily last you a full day and the best part about it is that it has super fast charging. Now for the others: Display: Its the best! trust me I have never seen anything like it before. the HD videos look crisp and clear. The Edges on both sides make it look absolutely stunning. Camera: This is probably the best part about the phone. The images look beautiful, the pictures are sharp and colors are quite accurate especially in daylight conditions, my colleagues keep asking for my phone when they want to click pics and no loger look for an Iphone! The selfiesby the 5MP cam are very detailed and nice. UI & graphics: The Android is the latest 5.1.1 which is definitely a improvement over the previous one, very simple to use, Most apps and High graphic games run very smoothly and so far I have not experienced any lag, the Apps open very fast and the multi window buttons is very useful. The fingerprint sensor for the lock screen is simply awesome and once you get use to it you will find entering password on other phone very cumbersome. The screen mirroring option with my Samsung smart TV is something I am really enjoying. Call & Audio quality: The call quality is great and the Audio is the really good especially while listening to music. Bottom-line is that this is undoubtedly the worlds best phone, it beats all other flagships at present, so if you can afford it dont think twice. read more ? 14 users found this review helpful helpful?

Now that S7 and S7 edge have emerged, they can possibly trump this phone, but over the better part of llast year, this was surely the best Android phone you can pick. If having a phablet is not a problem with you (one handed operation is a little difficult with a big-sized phone such as this) - this is really the best phone around. Super display. Butter smooth operations. Gorgeous looks that will turn heads the moment you take the phone out of your pocket. Seriously - we have to stop talking about whether the Edge has functionality or not. The dual curved edge display is a thing of beauty - and I will be happy with it even if it had no functionality like the app edge or people edge. 4GB RAM handles everything perfectly. 32GB memory is just right (Apple offers 16GB, which is too low, or 64/128GB which you may not want to pay for). Touchwitz is toned down and is not an irritant. In fact, some of the Samsung software touches are actually useful - like Private mode (which helps you to keep your files or photos private), and the ability to customize the toggles in the notification area (this feature is only available in Android M). The battery easily gets me through a day. The fast charging is really fast (around 1 hour to get from 20% to 100%) - but I'm told it's not always advisable to fast-charge. If you take care to put your fingerprint in properly as instructed, the fingerprint scanner works really fast. The camera is great too - probably better than any phone around right now. (I know there are phones with 20+ MP cameras - but megapixels aren't everything) The metal-glass body looks absolutely premium. Yes - the price is high, but you don't get the best phone in the world for anything less, right? If you absolutely do not want to compromise on any feature, and want to customisability of Android, then this is the phone for you. UPDATE: As on March 2016, this phone is not yet updated with Android M, but they did introduce several android M features gradually before Android M roll-out. For example, you have application permissions here already. You also have a system of choosing to optimise battery app by app (basically restricting apps to perform background functions when you haven't used them for some time). This phone is not available in dual SIM normally, but you can head to eBay for an imported dual SIM model. read more ? 12 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: Overall Good to buy if Camera is not main priority
reviewContent: I have pre ordered this phone through flipkart and I must mention that overall order fulfillment and delivery of Flipkart is just awesome. Overall a good phone. In some departments the phone is very good and in some it's just average or below average. 1) Built quality is very good. this phone looks and feels sturdy in hand and also feels premium, Not very heavy and not too light either. Weight distribution is good. Does not feel heavy at one end. 2) 5.5 " 720 p IPS Display with Corning Gorilla Glass 4 feels great. Color and brightness is just best in qulality. Touch is awesome. 720p videos run flawlessly and great to watch on this device. 3) 3000 mAH Battery is good to have in a 5.5" display. Power backup is good. But I am disappointed with the charger. It takes too long to charge the battery but that's adjustable. 4) ZenUI is very good and over my expectation. I have used lenovo UI, MIUI 6 and cynogenmod12 and I must say this ZenUI is no less in comparison. Look n feel is good. I would love to see a bit more Themes in the Theme store, a better secutiry app with app restrictions to use the internet but less preinstalled apps. Too many unremoveable preinstalled apps make this UI heavy taking up 5.26 GB after OTA update. Thus you get 10.8 Gb approx from the 16 Gb internal Memory.2 Gb Ram is good to have these days. Overall operation is smooth and crisp. This phone supports OTG (Tested) 4)Camera (Single Con I found): The 5 mp front cam with FF is good. Nice Capturing range.Beautification mode enhances the image. Photo output is good not great. Yureka and Mi note 4g/ Mi4i has better output. 13Mp rear camera with Dual Tone Flash and Laser focus. Here is where the main trouble arises. The auto Laser focusing is very quick, but you have no idea what outcome you are going to get after you click. Sometimes you get excellent pics but most of the time the photo is noisy and full of grains. I am very impressed with the dual tone flash, it works very good. But for one good photo you need to take 5/6 clicks. This made me depressed. I dint expected this from a hit brand like ASUS, What I feel is that they need more research on the rear camera sensor and need to release a OTA update to fix this issue. Sensor is not performing as expected. Its like a brainless instrument.Very disappointing. This is my first impressions after using this phone for 36 hours. Do give a like if it helps you. read more ? 315 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: Lacks in few departments, but stands out in a lot
reviewContent: So I had desperately been waiting for this phone since 2 months. Motorola definitely made me wait a lot. Well lets analyze this wait was worth it or not. 1) My phone is heating up like a microwave oven in 2 days use !! 2)I got my X style for 28000(after some offers), I feel its slightly overpriced(for 30000). Biggest feature which I miss about this phone is, that it lacks MOTO MAKER. Well this is something I was expecting to be there in this phone but Motorola has just not released moto maker in India. I would be happy with a price tag of 30000 had moto maker been there. 3) Another thing that goes against this phone is BATTERY which is strictly AVERAGE. 4) There is a lack of FINGERPRINT SCANNER as well. Now these were the cons lets look at Pros..Now lets look at what goes best: 1) Smooth processor Seriously very smooth. 2) Its not difficult to hold phone despite such a large size of screen, as moto has worked on phone s dimensions nicely. 3) Moto assist, moto voice etc, moto display awesome features. 4) Turbo charging helps a lot in time of need for a careless guy like me. 5) Screen: QHD(looks awesome) 6) The camera is also very nice, stands out. 7) The front facing firing speakers out shines completely. 8) The build quality is good, metal looks premium. 9) Dual sim phone, and micro sd card which is missing in most of expensive phones these days. 10) Voice quality of calls is very nice. 11) Stock android experince, will soon get Marshmallow update. 12) The front camera has flash(rare as if now in phones). 13) Twisting phones opens camera and other features are nice So basically the number of benefits outshines the number of cons.. So with my initial usage I can say that it is RECOMMENDED ! I would have rated it 5 stars, had moto maker had been there. reviewHeadline: Brilliant phone and excellent service by flipkart
reviewContent: The phone was released on 24th of October and I received it on the 26th of October. Great speedy delivery by flipkart(and awesome packaging too). Coming to the phone: The phone is just awesome, great to hold and looks stunning(almost bezelless) The highlighting feature is the camera- 21 mp is just awesome and the selfie flash is great. The phone is filled with sensors enhancing the user experience and is very snappy and fast. The snapdragon 808 handles everything exceptionally and has no heating issues yet. The speakers are great(very loud) excellent for viewing videos and playing games. The turbo charging again is the deal breaking feature for me, charges my phone super fast. Well cannot currently think of any cons... will try to keep you updated if I find any. 12 users found this review helpful helpful?

I received my moto X style last day and let me give the initial review. Pros: 1. Excellent display even though they are not using AMOLED display. You have options in the display settings to make the display either normal or vibrant. 2. Both front and back cameras are awesome. Even the photos taken in dark places appears good. 3. Another important feature that I like to emphasize is Moto Action and Moto Voice. Using these you can use your phone hands-free. 4. Then comes TURBO CHARGING...it takes only very less time to get charged from 0% top about 50%. 5. I have used Moto G previously and the one thing I was concerned most while buying MXS was its look and bulky. But MXS is nothing like Moto G...due to is curved design ..it looks sleek and the look is also pretty decent. 6. An earphone, turbo charger and a bumper case comes with the box. Although the b uilt quality of the earphone is not that great but the sound quality is pretty good. Cons 1. The most important disadvantage of this phone is its battery. It has only 3000 mah battery and it drains so quickly. Rigorous usage of the phone drains battery within 8-9 hours. But thanks to turbo charging ...you can charge it pretty fast. 2. I had bought MXS with 16 GB ROM. But out of this 16GB, only ~10gb is available for the user. But since MXS supports external SD card upto 128 GB, this is not actually a great concern. All together , this phone is a good phone with awesome specs. All the cons have an alternative solution to it ..Hence I find Moto X style one of the best phones in the market. read more ? 7 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: 1 4 inch screen so for all those who don't want to feel like they are holding a brick to their ear each ...
reviewContent: Pros: 1) 4 inch screen so for all those who don't want to feel like they are holding a brick to their ear each time they call, this size is ideal! 2) Par excellent battery life 3) Overall specs for the price are good; has Android Lollipop in it. Cons: 1) Someone mentioned in another review the the Call App crashed each time the loudspeaker option is turned on. I faced the same issue; was told to take it to their store to get it fixed. I just chose to upgrade the application while connected on Wifi and that seemed to solve my problem. But it is strange that such an error should come up in the first place. Shows that the UI is not thoroughly tested! 2) Worst problem I am facing is that each time I am browsing an app like Gmail or LinkedIn or say browsing the news on Economic Times, the particular app just reboots and goes off the page I am currently on. While the phone does not reboot, the app itself goes back to a previous page for no rhyme or reason. Has resulted in me having to keep hitting the save draft button each time I am keying in an email. Will try to see if this problem goes away after trying another upgrade. 3) Front camera is horrible... equivalent camera in my earlier Panasonic T11 phone had much better clarity. 4) Sound quality could have been better. 5) Data connectivity is sketchy. 6) The power on/off button on the right side tends to be depressed while speaking and has resulted in calls getting disconnected a few times. Should have been on the top of the phone. Perhaps there is a way to set such that call does not get disconnected even if the button is pressed, but then maybe I have not figured it out yet. 7) SARS value is also quite high for the phone, hence better to use earphone than holding it close to the ear. 8) Weight of the phone is higher. Overall, just an OK low cost phone, which seems to have high specs but which does not deliver as expected.. read more ? 4 users found this review helpful helpful?

I bought this phone from a local vendor, coz amazon was not giving delivery at my address :( I have been using it for the last 3 months, this is my review of it: Pros: Great battery life, almost 1.5 times than s6 and equal to iphone 6 plus(my previous phone). Amazing looks, this phone is definitely a head turner. The ability to use the stylus on the locked screen is really helpful. Build quality is much better than the previous generation notes. QHD amoled display is far more amazing than iphone 6 Camera works great in day as well as in night. Shutter speed is pretty fast. HDR pictures are life like. Optical image stabilisation. Finger print scanner works like a charm. 4G compatiblity Multitasking is as smooth as it should be. Thanks to the 4gb RAM NFC, Fast and wireless charging Multi page screen shot helps while capturing a long document or an entire web page. Cons: The glossy back is finger print magnet, have to clean it now and again. No option of expanding the memory, 32gb on this device seems way to less. Touchwiz interface No option of dual sim Costly No infra red, so cannot use the phone as a remote. Verdict: No phone is perfect, everyphone has its pros and cons. It just depends upon your need. If you are looking for a great looking phone with amazing camera and good battery life go for it. You wont regret. I am really happy with this device. Update:- The battery life of this is proving to be pretty good, with heavy use I am comfortably getting one day worth of battery life. Fast charging is able to charge the phone from 10-100 percent in just 90 mins :) :) Note: Wait for a month or so, the rates will come down by atleast '5000. If you liked my review, rate it helpuful. reviewHeadline: Not Worth Spending money on this
reviewContent: My Requirement for buying this mobile: 1. cdma+gsm 2. dual sim should be active instead of dual sim standby. 3. Good Camera 4. 2gb RAM 5. Latest Android 6. Good brand 7. 4g in gsm slot and evdo on cdma slot. My Observation after purchasing this mobile: 1. cdma+gsm - Pass 2. dual sim should be active instead of dual sim standby. - Fail 3. Good Camera - Pass 4. 2gb RAM - Pass (good performance) 5. Latest Android - pass 6. Good brand - Pass 7. 4g in gsm slot and evdo on cdma slot. - Fail(The most decisive point for selecting this model, however due to its design failure disappointed me a lot). slot 1 is for cdma as well as 4g, due to which you could not use cdma while having a gsm sim card for 4g. Then what is the point of having dual sim mobile. HTC should have done proper ground work done before releasing such models in to market. I bet this is going to be a complete failure model from HTC. It also has some kind of network issues. So finally i had to ask Flipkart to return this Item as it is a complete cheating to customers by HTC. Hopefully i get my refund from Flipkart. I will just rate One star because of its camera,processing speed, display and touchscreen. 17 users found this review helpful helpful?

Hi, So i ordered this phone on 1st of oct..it had no reviews still i went for it, expected delivery date was 13th but as per flipkart goodwill it got it delivered by 9th of Oct. Well i was high when i first gave a look into it..And what is this shit..I did not expect this thing will have graspy look.. So here you go, 1.The touch is quite responsive and fast enough.. 2.Processor is fast enough to handle 30 multiple apps at the same time. 3.Ram woooh this shit is really good..Opening Apps like hookers open their mouths..oops! my computer has also 2gb ram.waa :( 4,.Now this graphics card supports FIFA 15 and graphics is GODLIKE! I tried NFS most wanted..there is no LAG or DELAY in this high graphics game..FUCK gamers like me should by this..atleast better to have a phone worth of 20k and better spend on your PC 5.Camera! HA HA HA! at first i was not even able to find camera..then i found it is under PHOTOGRAPHY.. Rear Camera: YES it is good..seems like 8MP..Picture is clear Front Camera: No babes please do not buy this phone for your uglylooking selfies..but yeah you can video chat. 5.Internal Storage is 4gb accesable. 6.no 4G waa...but thats fine 3G speed is quite good. 7.IF u want a phone that looks good..this phone does that have quality..its so slim that if you are not handling it like a baby it will fall..Please ASUS atleast give a basic screenguard...OH GOD. 8.SOUND YES MUSIC LOVERS oops! there is no headphone in the BOX..but yes i used my PHILIPS headphones and music clarity is good..BASE LEAD RHYTHM VOCAL evrything is crystal clear...Loud speaker is also having a artistic sound, its loud enough guyz. 9.Finally this comes to battery..oh yeah..every smartphone users will have this query..Honestly everyone fears about battery.. No guyz 2070 is not GOOD enough. if you surf this phone hard and play games for whple day it will last about 1 day. So if you are living in a village where power cut is a daily bread then you should not buy this. But yeah if u can roam with the charger or Power Banks you SHOULD BUY. SO my final ratings: LOOKS-5/5 SPEED:4/5 CAMERA:4/5 TOUCH:5/5 CONS: 1.This phone is not having any screenguard,.Buy screenguard ASAP. 2.NO headphones.. What? Searching for more? reviewHeadline: An excellent budget android phone with super features
reviewContent: The phone I booked for my wife with some hesitation but after receiving, I felt relaxed to see all the functions and accessories (flip cover/screen guard) supplied with it. The outlook is great. It has 2 sims, 1 micro and 1 normal. The unforeseen feature of the phone is that it is a slim phone, only 8.2 mm thick. OS is kitkat 4.4.2. The pre-installed apps are good. The speed over 3G and wifi is very good with its 512mb ram. The display is a IPS one and 5.2 inches!!!! its awesome.... Camera clarity is good for both front and back. Loudspeaker sound is a bit low , I felt, but it is OK. the headset supplied is very attractive and gives a very good output. The sound recorder is so-so. All the sensors are working fine. The only cons which I saw that the charging USB cord is a bit on shorter side. The delivery of the product strictly followed the timeline promised. All together it is a very good but affordable product for indian market and it is truly friend's envy. [ already some inquiry came to me from one of my wife's gf.......:-) ] 0 users found this review helpful helpful?

The performance of the phone is top notch. Screen is crisp, bright and displays true colours. I can easily handle the phone.Nowadays we don't watch videos more often but for web browsing purpose it is the best. The camera is one of the best, the optical image stabilisation works very well and the images come out clean and crisp. The battery is awesome, the battery lasts for 2 days after 2 hrs of voice calling, 4 hrs of web browsing and 1/2 hr camera usage, and 1 hr of music. The long lasting battery will probably draw large number of consumers to buy this mobile phone. Overall I am very delighted to own this beautiful piece of mobile phone. 5 users found this review helpful helpful?

The product was delivered well within time, thanks to Amazon's prompt service. Coming to the phone, i brought it in the month of July, for my Mom. She was happy to receive it owing to the ease in operations it provided her with - large key pad, clear & large fonts on the screen, wide, clear & bright screen, single button for torch & lock/unlock, SOS, easy SMS options, one button radio, & clarity of voice on making or receiving calls. Plus it had an SD card slot for additional storage needs. I was glad i brought this phone for her to make things easier. Its been two months since i brought the phone now, all was working well until suddenly last week, the MIC stopped working & Mom was unable to hear what was being spoken on the other end whenever she made or received calls! She had to use the H-Free or Loudspeaker option to be able to hear anyone speak! Further, the Adapter of the charger stopped working all of a sudden & i had to buy another adapter to connect the USB cable of the phone for charging! So both these defects in the phone have left me pretty disappointed with the product, that too within just 2 months of purchase!! Don't know if i received a defective product or the phone quality itself is a little poor. Did anyone else have a similar experience with the phone? Whatever the case, there is no Philips Service Centre in my city & i am having to give the phone away to a local repair shop now, for MIC repair apart from the additional cost i had to incur for buying a new adapter! I do not think that a 4000 bucks phone from a company like Philips will be that poor in quality! I cannot even return or replace the product with Amazon because its past time for the same. But i do hope that these kind of repairs do not crop up every now & then because then, buying this phone will prove to be a total loss for Mom & me! Looks like i got a defective or duplicate piece from Amazon! Hope they ensure & do a thorough quality check & a check for its originality before displaying them for sale on the site. As far as this purchase from Amazon is concerned, i am Disappointed customer. A great phone but didn't work good enough! read more ? 13 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: ZTE Blade QLUX Review with full specification
reviewContent: Pros: *Super performance *Lag free. *High graphics games supported < GPU Mali-T760 MP2 clock speed above 500MHz, near about 700MHz> *Superb battery backup *High quality calling *Good Display Cons: *Poor Camera : Rear camera gives VGA quality, front camera gives 1.3 MP quality < I think it will be due to camera driver in Software, Lollipop update may solve this issue> *USB OTG not supported <Firmware bug, may be solved with lollipop update> *Adaptive brightness is buggy. <Firmware bug, may be solved with lollipop update> *Multi-touch only upto two fingers *ZTE UI is Poor *Loaded with some ZTE bloatwares *SAR value is little high .959 <It is lower compared to Redmi 1S and Infocus M2> Never thought ZTE will release such a poor camera device: Rest of the specification is awesome. http://specdevice.com/showspec.php?id=5eb1-76bb-5da6-a8b30033c587 11 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: Impressive Features for such a low price updated 02072015
reviewContent: ZTE has already offered a lot of devices with better features at competitive price. ZTE blade QLUX is one of them.i am not going to compare it with other high end phones with same specifications and with a higher price Tag. #>Will try to keep it sweet ,simple and to the point. With this handset you doubtlessly get much more than you pay for. Although to be honest you should't be expecting a camera quality seen in a 10k mobile with 8MP.You shouldn't be racing for megapixel because it doesn't make a camera better. But blade QLUX is probably the best camera you could get for 5k ,also the front snapper too. It sports a 4.5 inch screen which is perfect for single handed use. The handset looks much premium on hands on experience. it has GPS with Glonass assistance which is rarely seen in budget phones. One more rare feature is updates ZTE has promised lollipop updates for this phone.mostly rare in budget android devices. The screens not HD but for a 4.5 inches its enough and the 218ppi avoids pixelation. Mediatek MT6732M is the same we have seen in sony xperia E4g.And it powers the device well to keep it lag free. Mali-T760MP2 which was one of the fastest back in 2013 ,is still capable of giving the handset a better Graphics and gaming performance. (Though you have seen the same GPU in lenovo a7000 and xperia c4 to be specific). 8gb internal may be enough but as far as app installation is concerned on 4.5GB free for that.Rest is taken as other storage.Better consider buying atleast a class 10 memory card. Battery backup is surprisingly good and better than most in the same segment.You can expect a full day backup on average usage. The software and hardware are well optimized to avoid much of the heating. One more thing to be aware is the 4g part.Only one sim supports 4g the 2nd one supports only 2g . ------------------------------------------------------------- #>Everything has its flaws: not the lightest for a 4.5 incher.but light enough. Loud speakers are loud enough but sound quality is not that great. Automatic brightness does have some bugs.[waiting for the update] #>Would i Recommend it. Yes! surely,as far as the price is concerned its one of the best you could get.And as i said,don't keep your expectations high though you get much more than you pay for. ______________________________________ read more ? 10 users found this review helpful helpful?

Good display quality Excellent camera fast response --------------- verdict: ---------------- power packed smart phone with powerful camera and processor for fast action. one final word: -------------------- If you feel my review is useful to you, please press "YES" button below. 29 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: AMAZING MUSIC EXPERIENCE!! GO FOR IT!!!
reviewContent: I have been using this model for a month now, and I must say no issues till now. No hangs, no glitches, no sudden restarts; none. As per my opinion following are the pros 1) Amazing front dual speakers:- Yes the quality stands out completely when compared to any other non HTC mobile in it's range. Come on they are Dolby and have Surround audio. No comparison whatsoever. You won't get such an experience on any other non-HTC mobile. 2) In-ear Music experience:- The "BOOMSOUND" has it's advantage and you really understand the difference when you switch it off. The music is really crisp, the HIGHs are very clear and the LOWs are not artificial. Plug-in a high end ear phone and you will have an amazing experience, with the surround sound adding itself to the experience. 3) Front-Camera:- one of the sharpest cameras in this price range. The colours are not artificial and the clarity is really mindblowing. a perfect selfie camera. 4) Screen Clarity:- It's a 2k resolution. What more can you ask for. You get to see beautiful colours and really sharp images. Great clarity. 5) Fast operation:- The mobile has not yet given up on it's smooth functioning, is very smooth in operation. Though we are a bit doubtful about Media Tek Processors when we are aiming for a high end mobile, let me assure you the Helio processor is really really good. no Lags till now. 6) Built Quality:- its HTC!!! Need I say more??? the premium feel you get when handling this device can't even be compared to any other devices from it's range. It's not heavy and yet it's not too light and hence it has that premium feel. 7) HTC sense 7:- The look and feel is really good and comfortable. I loved it. 8) Design:- Look at it man, it's BEAUTIFUL!! Yes people stop and ask for it's name. It's an eye catcher. 9) Fingerprint Scanner:- It is very fast and seldom fails to scan a finger. I would say 95% of the times it is accurate. CONS:- 1) Chrome:- the keyboard kind is slow and does not respond fast while you are using it in chrome. I have no idea why so but it is laggy. 2) Keyboard:- At times it kind of behaves laggy. The most irritating feature is that you can't select just the "Word Prediction" option alone. The "Word Prediction" option in itself has a "Word Replacement" feature. So the suggested word will replace your word automatically IF your word is not saved in the dictionary. And this really starts getting annoying after a while. If you de-select this option then no word selections for you. You cannot change the keyboard skins nor can you customize it's layout. I had a Sony Xperia Z and you could do anything and everything with it's keyboard. While for some this might not be a problem but for me since I use the keyboard extensively, it annoys me to no limits. 3) Battery Life:- Batter life is slightly below average WHEN using internet continuously. While this is common with every other mobile out there, when comparing it with my Sony, the latter had a much better battery back-up. If the internet is off(both WiFi and mobile net) the stand-by is pretty good. When in music mode, the battery is decent, not as good as the Xperia's battery back-up. I must say Sony has the best battery back-up when it comes to listening to music. While I must say HTC ONE ME battery charging time is really short. It charges up really fast. 4) Back cover:- The Back Cover attracts finger prints very easily. While I personally find it a bit messy since it becomes sticky after some use. I wipe it every time with a cloth to remove the stickiness. 5) NO WATER PROOF FEATURE. I would say for the price you are paying, it is an amazing mobile. Recommended for those who LOVE listening to music and want a really good experience. The Speakers are mindblowing and watching movies without any ear phones is an experience in itself. The screen quality is also really great. But yes HTC's build quality is what makes it special. you get that premium feel of using a really high end mobile for a price of 35k. Go for it. read more ? 14 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: Best Dual Sim smartphone out there
reviewContent: Hi, I have purchased it from retailer and got it for 36K on 18 Aug 2015 with VAT bill. Have used it for about a week now and I must say this is very good handset at this price range. Following is my feedback which might help you. Pros : 01] 32 GB internal will give you enough space to install huge games and many apps (I have installed around 10 GB of high end games 02] 3GB RAM will give you buttery smooth performance 03] 20 MP rear cam is superb and gives you clear normal/bokeh/photobooth images and 4K/slow mo/fast forward video 04] 2K 565ppi display is crystal clear and have 178 degree viewing angle 05] Very responsive finger print sensor which lets you add 5 fingers 06] UltraPixel front cam for wide angel, low light support selfie 07] HTC Boom Sound speakers with HD audio play back (Note: they are not very loud but loud and clear enough to enjoy) 08] 4G on one sim and 2G on other which lets you use high speed internet with less battery drain 09] Poly-carbonate back gives you less heat feeling and rich look 10] Dual Nano SIM and 2TB external storage support, what else you need? 11] Features like,auto answer when directly held over ear, flip to mute, louder in pocket, goes to lower ring when picked up are added bonus feature 12] HTC Sense 7 with blink feed is good experience and launcher is smooth and lite 13] Many inbuilt apps to have as added advantage for photo and video editing but no bloatware 14] Octa core 2.2 GHz helio x10 processor for fast and responsive multi tasking 15] PowerVR G6200 GPU lets you run any game you throw at it with no lag (depends on number of background app you run i have around 10-15 background apps running always) 16] In ear headsets are just superb and very very loud and clear! 17] Extreme Power Saver will help you to last for a day with only 5% batter! 18] NFC support let me use my Jabra ROX and JBL Pulse NFC features to just tap and connect! 19] IR remote sensor lets you use your mobile to operate set up box, TV etc. Tried it with my Sony Bravia smart TV. Didn't worked with Panasonic AC though. Cons : 01] Battery back is not up to the mark, battery drains in 5 Hrs video play back at auto brightness and with headsets. On normal usage, continuous WiFi enabled, 30 min calls, 30 min audio and 30 min video play back, battery can last for a day. 02] Older version of lollipop 5.0.2, we need updated 5.1.1 with more smoother animations and yes update to M. 03] In pitch dark you can not have selfie so lack of front flash 04] 4K video length is max 6 min. 05] USB cable supplied is short and no extra accessory except headsets and a pair of extra nano sim slot, in case if you loose original one. 06] No fast charge but battery gets charged from 0 to 100 within 2 hrs approx 07] USB 2.0, no new flat USB cable which is better one I hope this help you. read more ? 12 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: Wondering Why I gave it a 4 Read on..
reviewContent: I got the phone two weeks after the Order date. Thanks to Flipkart's excuses of the Big Billion day and the huge logistics rush. I'd like to deep dive into the Con's first and the Pro's will follow: Alert: If # 4&6 of the Con's matter to you, don't buy this device. Con's: 1. Heats up a bit in normal usage @ times(I'd call this warm while most android users wouldn't)- The solution would be to Change the Power Saving Setting to Smart instead of Performance. 2. The Phone Seemed to lag a bit at the start, first two days. I don't face this issue anymore. 3. The battery did not last a 9 hrs with moderate usage after the first charge but I discovered that it lasts well over one day after 5-6 Charging Cycles 4. The Back Panel feels a bit slippery- Needs some careful handling- I'd recommend a good Silicone cover. 5. I faced some issues with Whatsapp Notifications being displayed when Whatsapp is killed- Found a solution for this on XDA Developers. 6. The Model sold in India comes with a single SIM when compared to the one sold elsewhere (UK/Rest of the world) which comes with a dual Sim + NFC (Yes, No NFC is available and it isn't really necessary I feel) 7. There isn't an inbuilt equalizer in the Stock Music App yet the quality of the sound output is Amazing (This should have been in the Pros but I'm just setting the context for the best features to follow :-D) Pros: (Best @ the Last) 1.Superior Build Quality- Feels premium, great design and the curved edges(like the one on iPhone 4s) make it look amazing. 2.The Screen is a killer- Makes an instant impression for itself. Flawless and appealing. Great Viewing Angles and good Visibility in Sunlight. 3.The Main 20 Mp Camera does an exceedingly good job and comes with a Sapphire Glass coating (IT is more Scratch resistant than a Gorilla Glass). Has great photo modes (Panorama, Good Food, Beautify to name a few..) and Video modes like Time LApse, Slow Motion, Normal with a lot off effects. The Aperture f2.0 lens help click great shots. 4. Comes with a Scratch guard installed- You needn't run to a shop to get it stuck and No bubbles whatsoever. Very Precisely stuck. 5. Voice Wakeup: Although not a very mature feature, helps place call, find the misplaced phone etc. 6. The UI looks flawless with no App Drawer. Zooming in on the screen brings up Hidden Apps where we can hide apps from the main screen. 7. The Selfie Camera: The best camera I have encountered on a device. Can be shot by simple tap on the scree/Volume button and touching the Finger print Sensor. 8. Gestures/Motions: Enable easier usage of the devices, Supports drawing letters to open Apps. Swipe up, Swipe down on the finger print sensor which acts as a soft touch input., double tap on screen and much more. 9. IR Blaster (The Remote Controller): Easy to configure. Supports most of my devices @ home. 10. Sound Output: Eventhough the speakers are only above average, the sound output from the device produces well refine bass that creates a great listening experience. 11. Customizable Function Key: One of the best features thats unavailable in a lot of premium phones. Lets open different apps/action for the three functions (Single Press, Double Press and Long Press) 12. The Killer Fingerprint sensor: The best Sensor by far on a phone. No need to press. A gentle touch on the sensor that is so ergonomically placed unlocks your phone. The Fingerprint sensor is quick. Go ahead and compare it with the iPhone's/Samsung's/One Plus 2's. Will win head on. My Conclusion: If you have a budget of ~22k, go for this phone if convinced. You will be amazed by the Build quality, the Vibrant Gorilla Display, Front and Rear Cameras, the smart design and the Finger print sensor for this Price. A great Value for money. read more ? 35 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: A nice buy for big screen lovers, performance, extra ordinary camera and more
reviewContent: It may look similar to G3 but LG has done a lot to differentiate it from other flagship devices. LG G4 is not just about specs but also the quality it holds. As you can see the bezels are small,which is really good for gaming and viewing FULL-HD Videos. The phone has a beautiful curve which make it excellent to hold. The display is surely one of the best to date and has to be seen to be believed. LED notification has over 8 colors,different for different notification. LG G4 has a removable battery which is rare in flagship devices.The battery backup is stellar for such a powerful device better do a research online about battery before buying. snapdragon 808 is surely a cooler version of 810(heating issues solved to some extent) The benchmarks may not be better than some other flagship but the real life experience is somewhat different and better. at the end you don't need to worry about performance when going for this beast. The camera with a 16MP and 1.8 aperture size seems to perform better in every condition. The daylight with HDR can handle the extra contrast really well resulting is excellent and sharper images.Even though samsung says s6 is best in low light by comparing it with iphone 6.they just didn't compare it with LG G4 which has the best 1.8 aperture size for stunning and sharp low light than most of the competition.The shutter lag is a little bit annoying.Its not the slowest but slow compared to other flagship.Selfie is surprisingly sharp. That's not the end either. The LG G4 has a laser focusing module on the back, which helps for focusing at low light and every difficult condition faster. The buttons at the back will take little time to adapt to. The sunlight viewability is great. The specs are definitely future proof. It also has optional wireless charging feature, which is Qi-enabled Above all the price is low than other flagships. Update: LG Has released an update to fix some minor issues with heating and all. Update pics: read more ? 24 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: Seen the Great, Felt the Great
reviewContent: Got this mobile from a retail store about 10 days back and boy what a mobile this is!!! I'll give you an overview of what i am experiencing with this mobile. DISPLAY :- It is one of the best. Its hard to take ur eyes off the screen. Colours are optimally saturated to make things vibrant (not too vibrant as in samsung). At max setting the display is bright and outdoor visibility wont be a problem. Add to this the slight curve and the compact 5.5inch form factor and u have got an awesome display in ur hands. PERFORMANCE :- The Snapdragon 808 as LG claims, seems to be nicely optimised for this mobile. There have been no hiccups so far. The graphics processor could have been a bit powerful though. Nevertheless, it will very much suffice ur daily usage and the occasional gaming sessions. UI :- This is one area where LG has evolved a lot. The UI is a lot smoother and it runs without any lags. LG hasnt compromised on the customisability. Bloatware is minimal and there are a few nice touches that will make using this mobile a lot easier (eg- smart cleaning, double tap to wake, dual window etc etc). CAMERA :- This is perhaps the best smartphone camera available now. Needs no introduction. Its AWESOME. The camera UI is minimal without any unnecessary filters. Most of the times u will find that the Auto mode will suffice, but if u have a bit of photography knowledge, Manual mode is what u would love the most. Ability to adjust the White Balance (in Kelvin values), Shutter speed (from as low as 1/6000 to as high as 30secs), Iso (50-2700), Exposure and Focus is a boon for those who want the best shot possible. Add to this the the ability to save the image in RAW format and u perhaps cant go wrong with this camera. Most of the times people compare this camera to that of S6, but believe me this one is the clear winner. The S6 produces great shots no doubt, but in low light this is the camera u wud want. Daylight pictures are more or less same for both except the fact that S6 produces images that are a lot saturated and may apparently look better to the eye. Same goes for the front camera as well. At 8mp, this is one of the best selfie camera. A few cons regarding the camera :- 1. Video recording and audio capture is not the best. The aggressive OIS makes videos wobbly and audio capture is not that good. There is no 60fps 1080p mode which is a bummer. 2. The camera tends to over expose and sometimes u will find the background light to be blown out. 3. Post processing is quite aggressive and occassionally u may note some artefacts(while u have zoomed in to the image). BATTERY :- Despite the fact that this is a 2k display, i have so far always got a Screen on time of 4-4.5hrs, which is quite good. Moreover, the back is removable and u can easily swap the battery. LG is providing an extra battery and battery cradle charger for those who pre-order/buy the mobile before 15th june. The mobile supports Qualcomm Quick Charge 2.0, but quick charger doesnt come out of the box. The provided charger (of 1.8Amps) charges a bit slow and it will take around 120-130mins for a full charge from 0% (provided u dont use the mobile during charging orelse charging rate will slow down even more). PRICING :- 49990 has now become a standard price tag for flagships and this phone is no exception. But since S6 and i6 are now available for a much lower price, its going to be hard for LG to attract customers (although G4 variant launched in India is dual sim and LG is providing free 3 months screen replacement alongwith 1leather + 1plastic back cover). However, having used this mobile for quite some time now, i must say this smartphone is totally worth the price. All in all this a great phone and certainly one that i will suggest to people in hunt for a flagship. The cons are not deal-breakers and im sure u wont even think about those after a few days. read more ? 23 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: LG G4 A practical performer with timeless beauty.
reviewContent: So I was in search of a new phone in the market, online market that is. Even though, I own an iPhone 5C which is almost 1.5 - 2 Years old and do love to keep Apple products as my primary device(s) of choice (Like smartphone, laptop etc), being a designer myself I don't keep myself restricted to one eco-system. I do love Android and the opportunities it brings for designers in designing great applications. That being said, in recent months world has seen some of the most beautiful and functional smart phones ever made. My requirement was quite clear from the start when I wanted to get a smartphone - A premium Android smartphone, budget no bar. I went through a box full of devices from Samsung Galaxy S6, S6 Edge, the OnePlus One, couple of other premium smartphones from Huawei, Lenovo, Asus etc; tried and tested them in showrooms and getting them for a day or so with help of some of my friends who own them. I liked the S6 Edge by far the most, but then after 2 days of usage, I felt no functional use of the curved edges other than the calls and smart edge feature and some amount of eye candy. Even though its a real well made phone with amazing camera, screen and built...the short battery killed it for me. Ofcourse, there is fast charging support but then what is the use of a larger pipe to fill a vessel when the vessel itself gets empty now and then. Maybe, Samsung takes care of this in next version of phone. I turned my attention to LG, which has a very very specific following unlike the large population almost the size of small country which follows Samsung & Apple. Even though, I had read several reviews of earlier "G" devices and its innovative button placement on back and real good camera, it was the G4 when I finally had a real chance to get a hands on of the smartphone. What grabbed my attention was the practical appeal for which Android smartphones were made - Replaceable battery (Icing on cake - its 3000MaH, unlike S6 / S6 E) and card slot for memory expansion. I saw the Black Leather back G4 and was immediately impressed by its classic design. It does not shout aesthetics and cool design like iPhone 6 or S6 Edge but it more of subdued yet beautiful design which if taken care properly will last atleast for 3-4 Years easily. Coupled that with a little curved horizontal design of screen and full glass from top to bottom and oh my it is a beauty on table; for sure you are going to get compliments and questions from people passing by your desk in office on "Which phone is that ?". The design on back is another story altogether, with its stitched leather backing (Its real animal sourced leather with vegetable tanning) and the awesome, almost aesthetic placement of buttons with camera showcases the amount of work LG designers have put into the device. Now the real deal - Screen : Awesome, 2K, 538ppi crisp screen. Videos and images in proper high resolution almost pop out. Colors are really natural unlike S6 which due to OLED even though are sharp but colors are a little saturated. I like true to life colors, not overblown. I played "n" number of videos and images and shared with friends and family, they all had 1 thing to say - They have never seen such a beautiful display. This comment also comes from an S6 owner himself who is a die hard fan of Samsung and hardly praises other products. Camera : I don't want to go gaga over camera, just want to say one thing to pass on the message - "The Best". Almost everything from 4K Videos at 30 FPS to ultra-sharp day and night images that too in RAW. You really have to experience it, even the selfie camera for that matter. Some say S6 currently has the best Camera. I somewhat agree, I think LG is better. Daily Usage / Speed / Practical usability : LG UX is not extremely refined like the one Samsung did with S6, but is un-interruptive, slick, super-fast. I have never, never, never seen slightest lag in switching apps / games or working around. Also, the device stays cool even on heavy gaming due to leather backing. Glass is a good conductor of heat and got real warm in some devices. The built in mono speaker is good / loud enough in chatter crowd, though I always prefer to listen to Hi-Fi music which this phone supports through headphones. The call quality is as expected, loud and clear (Almost bass emphasized like Nokia - which is really good as the voice feels a lot natural) through the ear-speaker even in weak network with the person on other side able to hear me without any issues. The phone also supports fast charging - Yes its true : 60% in 30 Minutes. Updates : LG did release initial patch for some speed updates and overall android bug patching, though this device will get Android "M" update in few months, skipping all the frequent "L" patches. I don't think its a major issue for me at least as the device runs pretty smooth. Sort of long review, but all I want to say that with my 2 weeks of experience with this device, I am almost certain to have it as my primary daily driver. A practical performer with timeless beauty. All I now want from LG in next version is some sort of Water / Dust resistant body, but truly the LG G4 is one superb smartphone to come in a long time. read more ? 16 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: Best features at this price but worst call quality
reviewContent: Pros: 1. Price Vs Features. 2. 5" screen. 3. Display clarity. 4. Accessories given(you get two screen guards, headphone, changer cum data cable, back case in the box) at this price. Cons: 1. Bad signal reception, voice breaks over calls. 1k phones will give you better call quality than this one. 2. Phone seems to be changing voice pitch and other voice aspects a lot. Unable to recognize even a well know persons voice. 3. Back cover looks cheap and fragile. Go for it if you want to experiment with your first smart phone and when you need all features that a middle level budget phone(ranging around 8k) can give you and when you are not too concerned about the voice clarity and call quality. 5 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: My finnal verdict, even though the Cons are major but in 299 I think it's an average phone
reviewContent: Lucky me! I got this phone in just 299/- on the Great Indian Freedom Sale, and at a price at this it is one of it's kind. Well to be honest, I though this phone's would be same size for any Basic Phone but it's size is smaller then expected, not much but you can actually hide it just in your palms. And it's actually MADE IN INDIA!!! Well getting on with the phone's performance, Pros: * It has actually 800maH battery, although its made by Raga, but still it's 800maH * It has music player, but speakers distorts the sound but it's okay in 300 bucks. * It also has Image viewer, Video player, Sound recorder and FM radio, in Multimedia Section. * It also has a memory to hold 500 contacts in the phone. * And in tools it has Alarm (with 3 timings), Calender, Bluetooth, Calculator, World Clock, and to my surprise it also has a LED torch light. * And in terms of Setting configuration, its pretty basic, Call Settings, Phone settings, Display settings, Security Settings, Network Settings and Profiles. * It also have a memory card slot, I tried 8GB class 4 and its working fine. * And one last thing, it also have a Icon for "Raga Treasure Box", which contains Blacklist and Auto Call recording. Cons: * The major disappointment is that its MRP is 900/- but has a distinctive look of a Toy phone due to its plastic body, which is very fragile and if you hold it tightly it might get crushed. * It doesn't have any GAMES, it only has a single game of Ninja UP, which sucks by the way and it only has 5 trials and after that you have to BUY it, WTF, who would buy a GAME in this thing. * And it doesn't have any functionality for the differentiation with regards to the SIM management, and if your planning to use this as a Basic phones with Dual SIM, I request you to please look other options. read more ? 7 users found this review helpful helpful?

When I purchased this phone I did not find any review. So here is my review for buyers. After long search with my needs I found this product under my budget. But few things you have to note before buying. Positive: 1. The display quality is very bright and also good in this price. 2. Touch sensitivity is not so smooth, it is average. 3. Sound quality during call, Speaker phone and Media play is very good. But supplied headphone is worst. 4. Aswom look. Back cover is mat type that makes well grip in hand. 5. Many features has introduced in this kitkat version. Menu item looks good. 6. Camera is very good. This is first time I found a well camera from Karbonn as well as non authentic brands. Auto focus, Duel LED flash, High quality secondary camera, Smile detection, HDR, Full HD recording (1920 x 1080), Panorama and Face Beauty mode are its well features. But there is no ISO selecting. Front camera also has auto focus. 7. Battery is very good. It is 3000 mAh and enough for this phone. Negative: 1. It uses Mediatek CPU that is not so good. 2. It has problem in GPS and G-Sensor receiving . It can not catch the signals any where . I came to know that this is a common problem from MediateK CUP and sensors. Karbonn has not fixed this problem. I frequently use offline and online maps, but this disappointed me. My problem will not be solved by the servicing center until it rooted. 3. Other sensor is average. 4. Product seal is worst. It is one sided seal. It can be easily open without cutting the seal of the product. This can be misused Extra Specification Note: 1. CPU- MT6582, 1.3 GHz 2. Cores- 4 3. Architecture- 4x ARM Cortex-A7 @1.30 GHZ 4. Revision- r0p3 5. Process- 28 nm 6. Clock speed- 598 MHz-1.30 GHz 7. GPU Vendor- ARM 8. GPU Renderer- Mali-400MP 9. Java VM- Dalvik 1.6.0 10. reviewHeadline: Good phone with attractive price tag, but I am facing few issues
reviewContent: I have purchased this phone 3 to 4 weeks back. I like the sleek design of the phone and features provided and very attractive price tag. I have been using this from the last 2 to 3 weeks and came across below issues. Contacted the Panasonic customer support and waiting for a response from them. Wanted to share the information for the benefit of other users who might be planning to buy the phone :) ISSUE# 1: When the signal is week and gets lost while on the call (Both my signal or the signal of the person whom I am speaking with) my phone is hanging and resetting/restarting automatically ISSUE# 2: While I am speaking on phone at times (~ 4 to 5 times a day) I am seeing a message that "SD card is removed un expectedly, please un-mount the card before removing to avoid any loss of data". Once the call is completed the SD card is auto detected and error message disappears. But, I will not be able to access the applications that are moved to the SD Card (Message "APP IS NOT INSTALLED" will display when I try to access the apps moved to SD card). I need to restart my mobile to Fix the issue and access the applications again. 12 users found this review helpful helpful?

I bought the Aqua A2 on Oct 27, 2015 from this Amazon page. I got the blue color model(see the pics). The accessories provided were charger, headphones, USB cable, user manual, warranty card, invoice, case cover and screen protection. I bought this mainly for a little more internal memory compared to my earlier phone. Since it's been only a day, I cannot provide a detailed opinion, nevertheless I must say it's been really good so far. I'll will update my review with more usage of the phone. Pros: -- The blue back cover(seems prussian blue) looks good and feels smooth to the touch. -- The touch is really smooth. -- Battery has been decent so far. ***NOTE*** The battery is removable. Couple of mobile review sites provide wrong info that it is non-removable. -- Internal memory available is nearly 5.85GB. -- Has Quickoffice(word, excel & powerpoint) that can be handy. -- The flash is good and I got a decent, close up selfie using the front cam. Yet to test the rear cam. There is video and panorama mode available. Cons: -- I've noticed that apps shortcuts on the home screen occasionally disappear after I transfer any media between PC & mobile! But I think this is more of an android issue as I read other brands too facing similar hiccups and occurs mainly on apps that I moved to SD card. -- The case cover provided as accessory is tough to remove once the phone is in. Rather than risk damaging your phone trying to pull it out from the cover, I suggest you buy more easier to use flip covers made especially for this phone and available on Amazon, or check out my reviews on the same. For the price, I think this mobile is very good value for money - unassuming looks yet reflects quality in function & design. Thumbs up :) read more ? 0 users found this review helpful helpful?

Please do not buy this phone. I've been using the Canvas Knight2 since ten months, and I've regretted buying the phone every single day. I spent Rs.16K on this phone (didn't buy it through Amazon), and it turned to be a bad investment. I should have bought a Samsung or Xiaomi, at a much lower price. I also have a Samsung J1 Ace that cost me just Rs.6000/-, and that's a much better phone, although Canvas Knight has impressive specs on paper. But only on paper. The main issue with the Canvas Knight 2 is its lousy battery life. Even on power saver mode, with all the apps turned off, the battery does not last more than ten hours - if I do not use the phone AT ALL. If I use it sparingly, only for calls and nothing else, the battery life does not exceed six hours. Even on power-saver mode, without using the phone at all, I still have to charge it twice a day. I dare not switch off the phone, because it always hangs when I switch it back on. Even during regular use, it hangs without warning. Outgoing calls are almost impossible, because the default dialer app keeps hanging. The Canvas Knight2 is the most expensive paperweight I have ever bought - because I cannot use it for anything else. For the same price, or less, you can get good models from Samsung or Xiaomi. read more ? 8 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: OK now about this phone What in the Box The Blu win LTE Phone Ear Phones USB charging cable But no charger Screen Guard
reviewContent: This phone has 1GB RAM and 8GB memory inbuilt! OK now about this phone - What in the Box - The Blu win LTE - Phone Ear Phones USB charging cable (But no charger) Screen Guard Plastic Case Some useless booklet which mentions help number A quick guide leaflet The Phone itself. The phone is a nice Feature packed little phone. Dual Sim 4G Support! Windows 8.1 4.5" IPS Screen (480x854) Snapdragon 410 (Quad core 1.2Ghz) 64 Bit CPU Adreno 306 GPU Which is good enough for mild gaming. 8GB Storage + Option for MicroSD card - Up to 64GB 1GB RAM 5MP Camera with Flash Front VGA camera Phone doesn t feel laggy at all. Starts well a quick setup and the phone is ready. Unlike Entry level Android phones windows phone does not hang or reboot. Very Stable from the Box, Not much bloatware installed. Just the some Amazon App installed, blu help came pre-installed. Very light weight phone. Phone has Dedicated Hard ware Buttons under the screen at the bottom and not software keys built into the display like the Lumia 535 and some of the newer Microsoft phones. This helps by giving you the full Display area - These Buttons are all backlit! good Sound Quality. Sides are metal finished, backside is plastic. The back plate is flimsy plastic. 2000Mah Battery. Which lasts long on a small phone like this. Oh wait did I mention this phone has Cortana?! Phone doesn t feel laggy at all. Starts well a quick setup and the phone is ready. Unlike Entry level Android phones windows phone does not hang or reboot. Very Stable from the Box, Not much bloatware installed. Just the some Amazon App installed, blu help came pre-installed. Very light weight phone. Phone has Dedicated Hard ware Buttons under the screen at the bottom and not software keys built into the display like the Lumia 535 and some of the newer Microsoft phones. Which lasts long on a small phone like this. Oh wait did I mention this phone has Cortana?! What I don t like about this phone - Camera Quality is Average at best. Even though it says 5MP camera the picture quality isn t that great. During day time you can expect decent pictures but at night the picture quality is just bad. Screen Quality is Average at best, Low screen resolution. Loud Speaker Volume is low compared to other phones Headphone Quality is again Below Average. Sounds like some cheap Chinese headphones. Phone has inbuilt Battery which will not allow users to replace the battery. Bottom line - Very good phone at this price range. If you are on a tight budget and are looking for a phone that is feature packed and wont randomly boot down or restart, this is the phone for you, I Fully Recommend this phone. read more ? 59 users found this review helpful helpful?
