reviewHeadline: CAMERA and Everything for Rs.8999 is GREAT.
reviewContent: If you are budget and CAMERA specific, then this one is for you.(UPDATED 15.10.2015) Camera :- Rear 13MP has 1/3.06" sensor from Sony (IMX 214), which gives good results than Any other phone(like Lenovo A6000,6000plus,7000 etc) in this price range. Full HD videos are crystal clear without any staggering@30fps and photos in low light are good too. Videos are recorded in MP4 format and not 3gp which is a great advantage. People should be aware of the IMAGE SENSOR SIZE and NOT the MEGAPIXEL factor. Front camera is a fixed focus camera with 1/4" sensor from OmniVision(OV5648). you can take Beautiful HD(720p) videos without any staggering @ 30fps in MP4 format ( 99percent of mobiles with price range of Rs.12-13k perform poor with low fps and they do stagger). 5MP is great with clear details. Beauty mode kills the originality, so kindly use normal photo mode. Selfies won't disappoint you. - Battery hardly lasts only for a day on an above normal usage. And 100 percent comes to 83 percent overnight in standby. May be because of Octa-Cores eating the battery. Honor is spoiling the brand name of Huawei with this one phone.....You can Foresee (4c). The other features of the phone will make you forget the battery. Battery is A issue but you will get used to it, until Huawei makes an update to solve it. - Lollipop Update available, which( both Beta B302 and B330 version) also eats the battery like the KitKat. No point in updating. KitKat update with "Firmware/Software of Honor 4C with improved battery performance" is available in Pakistan Huawei Website and it will not work for us. Google search for the words within "------", you will come to know. Latest KitKat update from Huawei India website is a bit more stable than the one which is available at honor India website . No point, it also eats the battery. Compatible KitKat Firmware versions for Indian Honor 4C so far released are battery eaters (B063, B070, B130-available at Vietnam site). - User Interface EMUI 3.0 is very simple, basic and very Easy to use. - Touch is Silky Smooth with ultra-fast response. - NO 60fps or 120fps recording in camera - Call quality is excellent. Speaker phone is OK, loud and above average or better than Honor Holly. If you want a blasting sound speaker phone then this will not suit you. - Display is absolutely great and far far better than Lenovo A6000 plus. - 2GB RAM is great and about 1.27Gb is free all the time - 64 Bit, 8 Core processor eats any game with ease and it is 2x faster than quad-core snapdragons in all aspects. - Continuous gaming and usage warms the phone. Heat is bearable and not as hot as iphone or samsung. - in-built phone manager app clears the junk and cache, whenever needed and background running apps can be controlled via phone manager app - Package comes with Screen Guard and charger kit. NO ear phones. - Dual Micro-SIM, Both are 3G and NO 4G in this version(4G is related to hardware of the phone and is NOT software specific. No 4G is absolutely no 4G). Net connectivity is superb. - Internet access is good - USB OTG function is available !!!!! - 3.38 GB available on board. Top it up with an external memory(32GB Available) card of 16GB class 10 from Transcend or Sandisk. If the battery issue is solved, You won't look upon other upcoming phones for the next two years at-least. HUAWEI means "Just buy it. It won't let you down"(for the price you are paying) but to honor the 4c, better go for Honor 4x(you won't regret and i have that too) Everything for the price of Rs.8999 is GREAT. Product delivered in just two days.Thankyou Flipkart. read more ? 98 users found this review helpful helpful?

I purchased this phone on 10th May and received it on 12th and here's my review of the phone - This phone is packed with great features for the price, no doubt about it. However, the problem is with the battery. I used the phone with 2G network, zero brightness and minimal calls. Absolutely no gaming/facebook/camera usage/GPS usage. They claim the battery to be 2550mAh but it doesn't even last for 10 hours with minimal usage! I had to charge the phone twice a day. I requested for a replacement and flipkart promptly replaced the product without any questions asked. I received the new piece on 20th May and it was the same issue with the new piece too. Additionally, there was another issue - a yellow patch on the bottom of the screen. The patch was uniform - about 1 cm from the bottom of the screen hence I requested for replacement again. And now the phone is completely DEAD. All I did was I turned on the Alarm and went to bed. The next day I woke up and the phone was completely dead. I tried the hard reset but no use. So guys, please think twice before buying this phone. 72 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: How to fix the battery drain issue and in review of the phone in short.
reviewContent: Battery draining issue could be solved by these steps. 1: Update all your apps after receiving the phone. 2. Clear partition cache after updating the apps. 3: Go to Settings>Manage apps>All>Google Search>Force stop the app and then disable it. 4: Restart the phone. 5. Leave your phone for few hours and you'll notice that the battery drain issue is fixed. ***How to clear partition cache*** >Switch of your phone. >Hold volume up and power key at the same time. Leave the keys ONLY AFTER THE HONOR LOGO APPEARS (Important) >Use the volume keys to navigate and go to the last option "Wipe Cache Partition" and use the power key to select it. >After the process is complete use the power key to select reboot. (Wiping the partition cache is absolutely safe and won't delete any data from your phone) Now coming on to the phone, this is the best smartphone you can buy under 10k, PERIOD! The phone looks great, will give you the premium feeling of a 30k phone. It is very well built with no creaking sound present anywhere. The display quality is great, the icons pop out on the screen and watching pictures and movies on it is a treat. There's no screen protection but they provide a good quality screen guard in the box so its not a problem. The performance of the phone is amazing with no lag whatsoever. I've played high end games like MC5, Asphalt 8 and Nova 3 on highest graphics setting and have never experienced any lag. There are some frame drops some times but nothing you can't live without. The UI is very good with lots of customization features. I've fallen in love with the Magazine unlock which changes the lockscreen wallpaper every time I unlock the phone. The camera is the best in this price range. Pictures taken in outdoor conditions have lots of detail and colours come out amazingly good. In normal indoor conditions the pictures are very good too and in really low light they're still very much usable with very low visible noise. There are lots of feature like All-Focus and Watermark which come out handy in different scenarios.The only thing I'm not happy with is the flash, it is not as powerful as it should have been. Battery is very good if you do what I said previously in the review. I get around 6 and a half hour of on screen time spread around a whole day with facebook, browsing internet, whatsapp, taking few pictures and a little bit of gaming. A lot of you must be confused between Lenovo A7000, Yu Yureka and Honor 4c like I was few days back. Just go for Honor 4c, you won't regret the choice. read more ? 53 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: Truely great phone. REMAX charger is pathertic.
reviewContent: I think this mobile deserves a big time recognition cos for the specs and the price this has been a dream come true for many people. I did not think twice before I bought this mobile cos I was comparing the hardware details with Microsoft Lumia 550. Microsoft Lumia has snapdragon 210, 1 gb ram and adreno 304. I think it has gorilla glass protection but I'm not sure. BLU WIN HD has Snapdragon 410 , 1GB ram and Adreno 306. The only worry is that this mobile doesn't have gorilla glass., But this comes with a screen protector and silicon case in the box. Which gives gud protection to the mobile and I'm pleased with it. Please use some good charger cos this mobile doesn't come with a charger in the box and Amazon is giving Remax charger free. Seriously Remax charger is super pathetic cos it takes almost 6 to 8 hours to charge this mobile. I can give one start less for not having charger in the box but I cannot reduce the star cos this mobile is seriously awesome. ****Edited: 21.10.2015: 11:15am The battery back up is good once I started using different charger than using the REMAX provided by amazon. If you contact the local Authorized BLU service center they will help you to buy a original charger for approx. $12(RS:750). If you use any other charger please make sure the output voltage is not more than 5V otherwise you will spoil ur handset. I used games like shadow fight 2 and tekkan, spiderman. I found the mobile lags when you use high resolution background. Since this being 720 hd screen you cannot use high resolution seamlessly. But once I change the settings the games work perfectly and seamlessly ( I'm enjoying it). The camera quality is ok for 8 MP and honestly this is gud for everyday usage. The immediate difference you can find from Lumia mobiles and BLU is the APPS. You cannot work any of the LUMIA apps like LUMIA camera, LUMIA smartshooter, mixradio, here maps. They don't work in this mobile.. Still there are other apps similar and you will not feel like missing a lot. Windows store in 8.1 is not very big because they are all migrating to windows 10 store and also developers are creating universal apps so that you can use one single app for multiple devices like WIndows desktop, laptop mobile and xbox. I think the app store will make huge progress from 2016 onwards. But you can find lot of utility apps and xbox games in the store. Overall this mobile is a sure winner and must buy phone. read more ? 28 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: People crying out loud for its bad camera performance should try it again after the firmware ...
reviewContent: Just bought the M9+ from a nearby retail store and loving it so far. I am not someone who plays games on phones but this MediaTek processor is not a slouch. Any current generation high end processor will be enough to perform day to day tasks without a hitch and I am someone who believes that we dont need gazillion cores to use a phone. People crying out loud for its bad camera performance should try it again after the firmware update. The Autofocus is improved considerably and it takes fine pictures now. You can play with manual settings to adjust the shutter speed and ISO levels to get a perfect looking low light shot. Let me give you a short background about where I come from. I bought the S6 on the launch day itself and faced the infamous pink tint issue on the screen. Got DOA done from the service center and the replacement device turned out to be worse than the original unit. Sold the hideous phone at a loss of INR 9k. So much for the so called Samsung flagship! Look at the general thread of S6 on XDA, people are crying all over this pink tint issue. Then came the iPhone, the so called God of all phones (BULLS**T!). Got the 64gb version and again ran into an infamous issue faced by many iPhone users. The screen was literally popping out of the metal casing right out of the box and made clicking sounds while typing messages. While Apple is busy milking huge profits out of customers, the least I expected was stringent quality control. Apple users make fun of companies like OnePlus and dont realize that their iPhone may have been manufactured right next door in China. I am a happy camper after today's purchase since everything seems to be perfect build wise on HTC and its the best I've used till date, quality wise. This comes from a person who has used flagships after flagships since 2011. Unless you aren't bothered about development and are not into custom ROM's, M9+ is a good buy and I would highly recommend it. If you are someone who cares about custom ROM's and a spanking camera on the phone, this one's not for you. This is the most underestimated phone amongst current flagships and I would highly recommend it to anyone to cares about experience rather than benchmarks or names like Qualcomm. Qualcomm seriously messed up with their SD 810 in a hurry to bring out a 64 bit SOC. read more ? 40 users found this review helpful helpful?
I was to buy I Phone 6 . But with the release of M9+, i am soo satisfied with HTC. The new fingerprint option is so awesome! A better buy than I Phone 6! 18 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: Honor Bee Excellent budget phone under Rs5000
reviewContent: Received the product today afternoon (Wednesday). Booked it on monday. Got it the same day as the launch date which is 13-May-15. As always lightning fast delivery by flipkart, kudos. The phone looks great, looks sleek and trendy.I bought the one with a white back cover (Just like my Honor Holly). The phone comes with a USB charger nothing else(no headphones). You should not expect it though given that they did not provide it for the Honor Holly either. No complaints given the price, the specs are great. 1 GB Ram is critical to run many of my everyday apps.The screen quality is excellent, displays are very sharp. The navigation is smooth, with absolutely no lag. The battery seems to be holding up pretty well (Can't comment, just got it this afternoon :) ) I got a Rs500 discount for my credit card. For a price of Rs4,500/-, this phone is a steal. Go for it! Adding more feedback. The picture quality on the primary camera is excellent given that it is a 8MP camera. The secondary camera (2MP) for selfie shots are decent too(Not fantastic, though). The battery life is decent, last for a day with normal useage (means no gaming). My aunt recently bought a micromax yureka yu for about 9K. The display of Honor Bee is distinctly superior to the micromax yureka phone. Overall very happy with the performance of the phone. I am not a gamer so, no gaming feedback! Adding more feedback: People in the reviews, generally complain about the battery, that it drains fast. Initially yes, it drains fast for the first 2-3 days (don't know why). I would suggest installing "Battery doctor Du" app. It has a trickle stage charging for extended battery life. Ever since, the battery is holding up pretty well. No complaints! Bottomline: Strongly recommend Honor Bee. read more ? 68 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: Flipkart Late delivery , Received defective Mobile for HTC E9 Plus Rs. 35000
reviewContent: I have purchased a New HTC E9+ Plus Mobile from Flipkart .com of Rs.34, 999/- on 22-06-2015 Firstly i have paid extra for their express next day delivery. but i have received the mobile after 2 days. When i have asked to return to refund my extra monEy, they "DENIED". After receiving the mobile, the mobile charger was found not working - DEFECTIVE. I went to HTC service as per Suggested by Flipkart Customer care person 2 times. But HTC service center has DENIED to take the mobile as it was purchased from FLIPKART & NOT FROM A DEALER. When i have highlighted the Issue with FLIPKART customer care person on the same day (11-07-2015) they told me that i will resolve the issue by 15-07-2015. On 13-07-2015, i received a call from FLIPKART executive stating that FLIPKART WILL TAKE BACK THE MOBILE WITH IN 3 DAY & REFUND ME THE MONEY AFTER 8 WORKING DAYS IN MY ACCOUNT. . I HAVE ALREADY PAID HUGE AMOUNT ON TEMPERED GLASS & BACK COVER FOR THE MOBILE. ALSO IT IS A BIG HARASSMENT FOR ME AFTER BUYING SUCH PREMIUM PHONE. I AM FACING A BIG HARASSMENT FOR LAST 20 DAYS & UNABLE TO USE TO PROPERLY FOR WHICH I HAVE PAID A HUGE AMOUNT. HIGHLY RECOMMENCED NOT TO PURCHASE FROM FLIPKART. 49 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: HTC One E9 will beat even the higher budget phones on features and performance
reviewContent: This review is after 4 days use of the device. First of all the outer look will beat any phone in the market, sleek, appropriately combined with colors (Gold Sepia looks the best). Display is very vibrant and everything appears real in the screen. Second comes the Camera. No doubt a 20 MP camera does all the wonders required on daily life. Even there are certain modes which are available on DSLR cameras only. Third comes the battery. 2800 MAH battery is enough for full day use even if you are a hardcore mobile user. Here are my own examples- Day 1:- Received in the evening a 5 PM and when opened, the battery was 58 %. I switched on the phone, configured it with Wi-Fi and used continuously up to 10 PM via Wi-Fi only downloading the apps, doing personalization and transferring all the things from old phone and the battery left at 10 PM was 21 %. Day-2:- Fully charged previous night and the battery remaining in the morning was 89 % then I started the day again at 8 AM with the same curiosity things on a new phone and kept 3G on permanently for whole day and using Whatsapp, Facebook, net surfing and at the end of the day at 5 PM, the battery remaining was 39% which lasted for whole night and needed charging in the morning. Day-3:- started with 100 % battery at 7 AM and installed about 100 apps and configured all of them, watched videos, taken pictures, whatsapp was permanently on and 3G was also permanently on. Made my own themes and did various things not allowing the screen to be off even for a second i.e. used it continuously for 5 hours doing all the things and screen was kept open for 5 hours continuously without a blink of screen. Any other phone would have begged for charging and would have heated up to boiling point but this one left with 27 % battery and cool like was kept in AC. All these things were apart from the calls I received and dialed which is average 40 calls before noon and 40 after noon. P.S. :- If you switch off data connection, you ll wonder from where it s operating i.e. battery is almost not at all used. I don t think anyone would require more rigorous use of phone than this. So you can be sure of battery lasting the day long irrespective of your field. The features don t need to be told as are already mentioned. Yes corrections are as below- 1. It s a dual SIM phone not a single SIM 2. SD card support is up to 2 TB and not only 128 GB 3. The weight of the phone is 135 gm and not 150 gm All these features are not available even on high budget phones up to 55 K so you should grab it for sure. Cons:- 1. The phone is large in size and its because the bezel is much more. The size can be reduced by almost an Inch if HTC would have designed it precisely. 2. User Interface is not as much appealing as is in Samsung premium phones and LG premium phones. I was using LG G2 and I will still declare it a winner over E9+ on inner appearance of the phone. 3. HTC is giving a charger with 1 AMP adapter which will require about 2 and half hours to charge the phone to full. They should have given at least 2 AMP so that charging time could have been reduced to half. Overall it s a treat on 35 K. You won t get such features in this budget and that too from a renowned company like HTC. So don t think, just go for it. read more ? 30 users found this review helpful helpful?

Purchased Lumia 430 a week ago at Reliance Digital, Kamananahalli, Bangalore ! ( not that i dont trust Amazon service ) , At this price this phone is a super deal, here are the Pros and Cons : Pros : 1) Looks good in hand 2) The plastic back case is not at all cheap , looks and feels pretty decent 3) Screen Clearity is good ( way better than karbon or micromaxx phones at this price range ) 4) 1GB Ram really does the job , phones operates smooth absolutely no lag whatso ever & 8GB of memory 5) Touch is very much responsive 6) Battery back up seems good ( should last one day ) 7) Tried Subway surfer, temple run2 , candy crush , Hill climb and 3D chess (absolutely no lag at all ) 8) Amazing call voice clearity at both ends ! Cons : I would not be writing any points here considering the price range , but yes there are flaws which i noticed 1) no flash 2) camera picture quality is just Ok in daylight , but a big no no in the night , goes same with the front camera ( but you should still be able to make skype calls ) 3) not a con but yes keep those micro sims ready if you currently have a normal sized sim card 4) thinking hard to figure out more points , sadly not able to ... Bottom line : At this price of 5k from a good and trusted brand like Nokia/Microsoft this product which can accomodate all the vital apps like whatsapp, viber, true caller, skype (simply download them all from windows store) etc etc what more do you need !!! Just go for it if you are on a limited budget or wanna gift it to your mom, younger sis/bro in college ( you know what i mean ;) read more ? 30 users found this review helpful helpful?

This is, as of now, the cheapest Lumia Phone to hit the market. Yes a few sacrifices have to be made to make it just about Rs 5150. But that doesn't mean poor quality. Or bad functioning. In fact this phone's specifications are pretty much better than what we're used to. It is a 4 inch phone with an agreeably sharp resolution of 800 480. Sharp because it is on a 4 inch. Sadly the display enhancement technologies like ClearBlack are not available. Ambient Light and Proximity Sensors have been included meaning Auto Brightness will work here. The phone has a storage capacity of 8GB which is expandable to 128GB with an external SD card. The processor is a Qualcomm Snapdragon 200 SoC, with dual 1.2 GHz Cortex A7 cores. This is good since Windows Phone OS is good with low end devices in terms of speed unlike on Android. One will be able to access the whole Windows Store of Applications as this phone has 1GB RAM. The main camera sadly is just 2MP while the front camera 0.3MP. This are the major drawbacks of this phone. A 5MP camera would be better Microsoft. The phone comes with a 1500mAh battery which is also too low for most users nowadays. Opinion : Is this a good phone? Yes. Would I buy it if I wanted a low end Windows Phone? No. Why? Because there is the Lumia 535 which beats this phone in everything and I'll only have to add a few thousands. But if one can't afford the Lumia 535, then this is the one to go with. read more ? 23 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: music application can not handle more than 500 songs, nokia 220, 225 is simple yet better than this
reviewContent: its a good budget candybar phone, bought from local store in 3300. overall looks is good screen is nice (not very crisp) have not tested battery yet but so far seems to be good enough, 1000mah. 3mp camera seems to be good for the price, video recording is pathetic. cons- performance is not as smooth as nokia 220 and 225 (series30) OS its music application is not reading my 500+ songs collection in my memory card, i have 5gb songs in that card, and the same card was running flawlessly in nokia 130(1600 rupees phone). but in this samsung mobile i am not able to play songs, it is not able to handle my 7GB song collection, that is disappointing so if u want to store too many songs then just do not buy this phone. the direct competitors of this phone are nokia 220 and nokia 225. and they are a lot better performance wise. if one wants flawless and smooth operations then chose nokia, and if you want some shortcuts in your mobile and more features then go for samsung 360 the screen is better in samsung. also the music sound production is better in nokia, nokia has less features and options as compared to this mobile but nokia operates super smooth even with full 16 gb memory cards, whereas samsung tends to lag little bit to handle large volumes of data 7 users found this review helpful helpful?

reviewHeadline: Excellent in LOOKS Overall Decent PERFORMANCE Read this review to knowIF ITS PERFECT FOR YOU?
reviewContent: I have used a bunch of Karbonn Smartphones in the past also reviewed them here at amazon.Recently i got this smartphone for a review. Upon launch 'Mach Two' was priced near 10k.And due to lack of customer interest,they reduced the price now.So,my review will be basically on the value for money point. It features some good specs and specifically the 8MP camera pair.which we saw in a low end Infocus handset months ago. NOTE: Opinions expressed are solely my own and Unbiased So here's my review, will keep it simple and to the point. DESIGN & Build Quality ------------------------------------- Design wise ,its premium but only in looks.The power ,volume button,sim and MicroSD tray are placed at the right side.Surely the design is inspired from iPhone 5s.And its very light.The front and back are covered with corning gorilla glass,which is only found in premium phones.It guarantees better protection against scratches and all.Its definitely the best looking device you could get at this price. The Build quality is decent,everything in plastic,now a days we see more phones with poly carbonate back.Gorilla glass may be good in some cases,except it may be slippery.So, better invest in a back cover with good grip. DISPLAY QUALITY ------------------------------- Its a 720p display with decent display quality overall.The viewing angles are satisfactory and the color reproduction is to the warm side,which needs to be calibrated from the software side for better viewing experience.The videos and images look good and you may not find anything different from other smartphones in the same range. CAMERA AND SOUND OUTPUT --------------------------------------------------- Most importantly it has 8MP camera pair,which really stands out on paper.But the real life camera performance is to the down side.As far as i have used other phones like redmi 2,moto e and all,they seem to perform much better.Both in images and videos.But still its a lil bit cheaper than both of them.Daylight shots looked good when zoomed out but when viewed at full resolution It looked grainy. Takes a little time to focus and intern its slow.Though the images looked much realistic than some other smartphones(which are over-saturated) . In low light, the camera took images laced with noise and they were mostly unusable. The high resolution front camera is also a below-average performer. Sound output as usual,its good.Karboon is known for making loud speakers.This time they have placed them at the bottom side which actually avoids muffling.But it doesn't mean the quality is premium. Performance and GAMING -------------------------------------- It has the outdated Android v4.4.2 KitKat operating system.Don't think karbonn will be pushing the lollipop update any time soon.The overall performance is satisfactory.It has 1.4GHz octa core processor with 1GB RAM..It may be enough for normal users but The meadiatek 8 core processor fails to provide fluid UI experience.Intern the UI and entire software is bug market.Apps and stuff crashes occasionally if you do some multitasking. Gaming experience is satisfactory.Yes,all low end games like temple run,subway surfer are playable.Can handle some HD games but most of the graphics seemed washed out. Though you may not notice any heating issue,that's common in every other smartphone. BATTERY Backup ---------------------------- The 1.9k mAh battery powers the device pretty decent.You can expect the device to last 7 hours and so on normal usage and 5 and down for heavy usage.You will roughly manage back home with remaining juice. The previous karbonn smartphone performed a little better in terms of battery. Conclusion ,The Tough part --------------------------------------- I can't say to go and buy this phone nor not to buy.Its has its own pros and cons which may or may not be suitable for everyone.If the primary concern is Design and decent camera with normal performance then it will work for you and is a good value for money as per your needs. Though i would recommend to increase your budget to get a far better camera experience. One Last thing ---------------------- Just in case you like my review,then don't forget to hit the 'YES' button below. read more ? 25 users found this review helpful helpful?

I didn't buy the phone from Flipkart but this is my observation after a week of using this phone. The phone looks fantastic right out of the box. But the USB cable and headphone are made of pretty cheap materials. There is a back case provided with the phone(in the box) and it is pretty decent. But barely any other options for this phone are available in the market in terms of back cases/covers. I am using 2 GSM sims on the phone along with a 16GB memory card. Phone has dual stand by. Call quality is just about ok. Its not loud enough even in full volume, atleast in my opinion. Persons on the other end said they could hear me fine, so MIC works alright i guess. Same observation for loud speaker, just about loud enough. The primary camera(back) functions decently in the outdoors and where there is sufficient light. Same goes for the front camera. But in slightly dim light the performance is very poor. The battery is non removable. It lasted very little on day 1, but i was exploring the phone for long. On day 2 it lasted a full day with moderate usage and the battery performance has remained stable since then. There are no notification lights on this phone. There are speaker ports on both sides at the bottom of the phone but only one side plays music, other side is dummy. The phone comes with a bunch of bloatware. I could not uninstall certain pre-installed apps. And the ones i uninstalled, got re installed automatically. To make things worse, the phone automatically downloaded 2 apps on its own, on day 1. And on day 3 it automatically downloaded 2 games. They just dont go away no matter how many times you uninstall them. Having used it for week now i havent faced any heating issues except for day 1 when i used it a lot. I am only a moderate user btw. For the price i bought(6K), i guess its worth it. The phone is great looking and goes about doing its job. Just dont have too many high expectation from it. read more ? 5 users found this review helpful helpful?

Recently I bought this phone @ Rs 8500 online, here is the quick review of this product. DESIGN & SCREEN Pros : It is one of the best phone designed by karbonn.8.5mm slimmer & a flip cover with this phone give this phone a premium look. It is the first 6"inch smartphone by karbonn& the first phone under the Platinum series.The screen is protected by Corning Gorilla Glass 3. Cons: It is having QHD 960x540 &296ppi though we expect more in this price range. Though it has good viewing angle & screen is bright in sunlight & even the 1080p videos plays smoothly without any lag. CAMERA The phone is having 8MP front & back which is able to click decent photos even in poor light..the color reproduction is natural, few detailing is missing but it is OK.. Cons: The phone record video in 720p (Karbonn low budget phones like Sparkle V & Mach One record video in 1080p) SOFTWARE The phone is running on Kitkat 4.4. and as Karbonn promises it will be upgraded to lollipop in future. The phone has smooth user interface. karbonn has experimented on app icons . HARDWARE It is where this phone lag behind. Karbonn is using the same MediaTek chipset in 5000 to 8000 price range. It is running on 1.3GHz Quad core processor & only 1GB RAM(should be atleast 2GB). But instead of that this phone perform better than other device with same chipset. It scores approx 21000 score in AnTuTu Benchmark which enough to handle heavy games,,It also have 16GB of inbuilt memory which is too much for any user 9GB is availabe for User we can also expand it to 32GB BATTERY & VIDEO PLAYBACK This phone battery run whole day after heavy usage. This phone gives a video playback of 4hrs GAMING & HEATING ISSUE I tried to run few games like Asphalt 8 & Fifa 15 both run smoothly with no frame drop. Few heating issues are found but not like other phone which heated up like a heater in which u can make a chapati. Verdict So at last i must it is the best 6" phone under 10000. as only micromax doodle 4 & Karbonn Platinum P9 is the only 6" smartphone under 10000. & between these two Karbonn perform much better in term of Camera & hardware performance.. If u want smaller screen with better performance Lenevo A6000plus & A6000/ Karbonn Octane & Micromax Canvus Nitro are some better smartphone in 8000 price range read more ? 7 users found this review helpful helpful?
